categories.description: Corset dresses feature structured, figure-hugging bodices often enhanced with boning or shaping panels. In African fashion, they're crafted with luxurious fabrics such as Ankara, Lace, Kente, and Aso-Oke, and are popular for high-profile events like weddings, engagements, and fashion galas.

categories.description: Structured, elaborate African headwrap, commonly worn in Nigeria and across West Africa for formal events. Often crafted from stiff fabrics like Aso Oke or Brocade, Gele symbolizes elegance, tradition, and cultural pride.
